info.title: Understand readme.md file fully line by line

parts.text: understand readme.md file fully each and every line
The user wants me to read and understand the README.md file. Let me read it first.

state.output:
<path>/mnt/d/Rk-Estates/README.md</path>
<type>file</type>
<content>1: # üèóÔ∏è RK Estates ‚Äî Real Estate Platform with Auto Plot Division & 3D Viewer
2: 
3: > A full-stack real estate web platform where admins define land dimensions, the system automatically divides land into plots, and buyers explore each plot through an interactive 3D view.
4: 
5: ---
6: 
7: ## üìå Project Overview
8: 
9: **RK Estates** is a role-based real estate web application with two distinct user types ‚Äî **Admin** and **Buyer**.
10: 
11: - **Admin** creates a project by entering land dimensions and the desired number of plots. The system automatically divides the land into equal plots and generates a 3D visualization for each one.
12: - **Buyers** log in, browse projects, select a plot from an interactive layout, and view a 3D model of that specific plot ‚Äî no site visit needed.
13: 
14: ---
15: 
16: ## ‚ú® Features
17: 
18: ### üë§ Buyer Features
19: - üîê Secure login & signup with JWT authentication
20: - üèòÔ∏è Browse all available real estate projects
21: - üó∫Ô∏è Click a project to see the auto-generated plot grid layout
22: - üßä Select any plot to view its interactive 3D model
23: - üìã View plot details ‚Äî dimensions, area, price, facing, status
24: - üì© Submit an enquiry directly from the plot page
25: - üîé Filter plots by size, price, and availability
26: 
27: ### üõ†Ô∏è Admin Features
28: - üîë Separate admin login with protected dashboard
29: - ‚ûï Create a new project by entering:
30:   - Project name, location, description
31:   - Total land dimensions (length √ó width in feet/meters)
32:   - Number of plots to divide the land into
33: - ‚öôÔ∏è **Auto Plot Division** ‚Äî system calculates and assigns dimensions to each plot automatically
34: - üßä **Auto 3D Generation** ‚Äî a 3D model is procedurally generated for each plot using its computed dimensions
35: - üìä Manage plot status (Available / Booked / Sold)
36: - üóëÔ∏è Edit or delete projects and plots
37: 
38: ---
39: 
40: ## üîÑ System Flow
41: 
42: ### Admin Flow
43: ```
44: Admin Login
45:      ‚Üì
46: Admin Dashboard
47:      ‚Üì
48: Create New Project
49:   ‚Üí Enter land dimensions (e.g. 200ft √ó 150ft)
50:   ‚Üí Enter number of plots (e.g. 12)
51:      ‚Üì
52: System Auto-Divides Land into Plots
53:   ‚Üí Calculates each plot's dimensions
54:   ‚Üí Assigns plot number, area, facing direction
55:      ‚Üì
56: System Auto-Generates 3D View per Plot
57:   ‚Üí Procedural 3D mesh created from plot dimensions
58:   ‚Üí Linked to each plot record in SQLite3 database
59:      ‚Üì
60: Project Published ‚Äî Visible to Buyers
61: ```
62: 
63: ### Buyer Flow
64: ```
65: Buyer Login / Signup
66:      ‚Üì
67: Dashboard ‚Äî Browse All Projects
68:      ‚Üì
69: Click a Project ‚Äî View Interactive Plot Grid
70:      ‚Üì
71: Click a Plot ‚Äî See Plot Details + 3D View
72:      ‚Üì
73: Submit Enquiry / Contact Agent
74: ```
75: 
76: ---
77: 
78: ## üß† Auto Plot Division Logic
79: 
80: When an admin creates a project, the backend runs a **plot division algorithm**:
81: 
82: 1. Takes total land `length √ó width` (e.g. 200ft √ó 150ft = 30,000 sq ft)
83: 2. Divides into `N` equal plots (e.g. 12 plots ‚Üí ~2,500 sq ft each)
84: 3. Arranges plots in a grid layout (rows √ó columns computed automatically)
85: 4. Assigns each plot:
86:    - Unique plot number
87:    - Computed dimensions (length √ó width)
88:    - Facing direction (East/West/North/South based on grid position)
89:    - Default status: `Available`
90: 5. Stores all plot records in SQLite3 linked to the project
91: 
92: ---
93: 
94: ## üßä Auto 3D View Generation
95: 
96: Each plot's 3D model is **procedurally generated** using Three.js based on its stored dimensions ‚Äî no manual `.glb` file upload needed:
97: 
98: - A 3D rectangular land parcel mesh is rendered from the plot's actual length & width
99: - Surrounding plots are shown as faded neighboring blocks for spatial context
100: - Directional compass labels (N / S / E / W) are displayed
101: - Road and boundary lines drawn based on plot position in the grid
102: - Orbit controls allow rotate, zoom, and pan
103: - Models are generated on-the-fly in the browser from dimension data returned by the API
104: 
105: ---
106: 
107: ## üõ†Ô∏è Tech Stack
108: 
109: ### Frontend
110: | Technology | Purpose |
111: |------------|---------|
112: | React.js / Next.js | UI framework & routing |
113: | Three.js | Procedural 3D plot generation & rendering |
114: | Tailwind CSS | Styling & responsive layout |
115: | Framer Motion | Animations & transitions |
116: 
117: ### Backend
118: | Technology | Purpose |
119: |------------|---------|
120: | Python 3.11+ | Backend language |
121: | FastAPI | REST API framework with automatic docs |
122: | SQLite3 | Lightweight file-based relational database |
123: | SQLAlchemy | ORM for database models & queries |
124: | python-jose | JWT token creation & verification |
125: | passlib + bcrypt | Password hashing |
126: | Uvicorn | ASGI server to run FastAPI |
127: 
128: ### Dev Tools
129: - Git & GitHub
130: - FastAPI Swagger UI (auto-generated at `/docs`)
131: - Postman (API testing)
132: - Figma (UI/UX design)
133: - Vercel (frontend) / Render or Railway (backend deployment)
134: 
135: ---
136: 
137: ## üóÇÔ∏è Folder Structure
138: 
139: ```
140: rk-estates/
141: ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ client/                              # Frontend (React/Next.js)
142: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/

144: ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/

150: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PlotInfoPanel.jsx
151: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ EnquiryButton.jsx
152: ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pages/
153: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ login.jsx
154: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ register.jsx
155: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dashboard.jsx
156: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ projects/
157: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.jsx            # All projects listing
158: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ [id].jsx             # Project detail + plot grid
159: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plot/
160: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ [id].jsx             # Plot detail + 3D viewer
161: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ admin/
162: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dashboard.jsx        # Admin home
163: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ create-project.jsx   # Create project + plot division form
164: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ manage/

166: ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ three/
167: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PlotViewer.jsx           # Three.js canvas component

169: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ controls.js             # Orbit controls setup
170: ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ context/
171: ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AuthContext.jsx
172: ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils/
173: ‚îÇ           ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ plotDivision.js          # Frontend grid calculation helpers
174: ‚îÇ
175: ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server/                              # Backend (Python + FastAPI)
176: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.py                          # FastAPI app entry point
177: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ database.py                      # SQLite3 connection + SQLAlchemy setup
178: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ models.py                        # SQLAlchemy ORM models (User, Project, Plot)
179: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ schemas.py                       # Pydantic request/response schemas
180: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.py                          # JWT creation, verification, password hashing
181: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dependencies.py                  # Reusable FastAPI dependencies (get_current_user, admin_only)
182: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ routers/

185: ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ plots.py                     # /api/plots routes
186: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ services/
187: ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ plot_division.py             # Auto plot division algorithm
188: ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ rk_estates.db                    # SQLite3 database file (auto-created)
189: ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ requirements.txt
190: ‚îÇ
191: ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env.example
192: ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
193: ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ .gitignore
194: ```
195: 
196: ---
197: 
198: ## üóÉÔ∏è Database Schema (SQLite3)
199: 
200: ### `users` table
201: | Column | Type | Description |
202: |--------|------|-------------|
203: | id | INTEGER PK | Auto-increment |
204: | name | TEXT | Full name |
205: | email | TEXT UNIQUE | Login email |
206: | hashed_password | TEXT | bcrypt hash |
207: | role | TEXT | `buyer` or `admin` |
208: | created_at | DATETIME | Timestamp |
209: 
210: ### `projects` table
211: | Column | Type | Description |
212: |--------|------|-------------|
213: | id | INTEGER PK | Auto-increment |
214: | name | TEXT | Project name |
215: | location | TEXT | Project location |
216: | description | TEXT | Details |
217: | land_length | REAL | Total land length (ft) |
218: | land_width | REAL | Total land width (ft) |
219: | num_plots | INTEGER | Number of plots to divide into |
220: | created_at | DATETIME | Timestamp |
221: 
222: ### `plots` table
223: | Column | Type | Description |
224: |--------|------|-------------|
225: | id | INTEGER PK | Auto-increment |
226: | project_id | INTEGER FK | References `projects.id` |
227: | plot_number | INTEGER | Plot number within project |
228: | length | REAL | Plot length (ft) |
229: | width | REAL | Plot width (ft) |
230: | area | REAL | Computed area (sq ft) |
231: | row_index | INTEGER | Row position in grid |
232: | col_index | INTEGER | Column position in grid |
233: | facing | TEXT | N / S / E / W |
234: | price | REAL | Price (optional, set by admin) |
235: | status | TEXT | `Available` / `Booked` / `Sold` |
236: 
237: ---
238: 
239: ## üì° API Endpoints
240: 
241: ### Auth ‚Äî `/api/auth`
242: | Method | Endpoint | Access | Description |
243: |--------|----------|--------|-------------|
244: | POST | `/api/auth/register` | Public | Register a new buyer |
245: | POST | `/api/auth/login` | Public | Login and receive JWT token |
246: | GET | `/api/auth/me` | Private | Get current logged-in user |
247: 
248: ### Projects ‚Äî `/api/projects`
249: | Method | Endpoint | Access | Description |
250: |--------|----------|--------|-------------|
251: | GET | `/api/projects` | Public | List all projects |
252: | GET | `/api/projects/{id}` | Public | Get project + all its plots |
253: | POST | `/api/projects` | Admin | Create project ‚Üí triggers auto plot division |
254: | PUT | `/api/projects/{id}` | Admin | Update project details |
255: | DELETE | `/api/projects/{id}` | Admin | Delete project and its plots |
256: 
257: ### Plots ‚Äî `/api/plots`
258: | Method | Endpoint | Access | Description |
259: |--------|----------|--------|-------------|
260: | GET | `/api/plots/{id}` | Public | Get single plot details |
261: | GET | `/api/plots/{id}/dimensions` | Public | Get dimensions for 3D rendering |
262: | PUT | `/api/plots/{id}/status` | Admin | Update status (Available/Booked/Sold) |
263: 
264: > üìò Full interactive API docs are available at `http://localhost:8000/docs` (Swagger UI) when the server is running.
265: 
266: ---
267: 
268: ## üöÄ Getting Started
269: 
270: ### Prerequisites
271: - Python 3.11+
272: - Node.js v18+
273: - pip
274: - npm or yarn
275: 
276: ### Backend Setup
277: 
278: ```bash
279: cd server
280: 
281: # Create and activate virtual environment
282: python -m venv venv
283: source venv/bin/activate        # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
284: 
285: # Install dependencies
286: pip install -r requirements.txt
287: 
288: # Create .env file
289: cp ../.env.example .env
290: # Edit .env and set your SECRET_KEY
291: ```
292: 
293: `requirements.txt`:
294: ```
295: fastapi
296: uvicorn[standard]
297: sqlalchemy
298: python-jose[cryptography]
299: passlib[bcrypt]
300: python-multipart
301: python-dotenv
302: ```
303: 
304: ### Start the Backend
305: 
306: ```bash
307: cd server
308: source venv/bin/activate
309: uvicorn main:app --reload --port 8000
310: ```
311: 
312: API will be live at `http://localhost:8000`
313: Swagger docs at `http://localhost:8000/docs`
314: 
315: ### Frontend Setup
316: 
317: ```bash
318: cd client
319: npm install
320: ```
321: 
322: Create a `.env.local` file in `/client`:
323: 
324: ```env
325: NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=http://localhost:8000
326: ```
327: 
328: ### Start the Frontend
329: 
330: ```bash
331: cd client
332: npm run dev
333: ```
334: 
335: Open `http://localhost:3000` in your browser.
336: Admin dashboard is at `/admin/dashboard` (requires admin role).
337: 
338: ---
339: 
340: ### Environment Variables
341: 
342: Create a `.env` file in `/server`:
343: 
344: ```env
345: SECRET_KEY=your_super_secret_jwt_key
346: ALGORITHM=HS256
347: ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES=60
348: ```
349: 
350: > The SQLite3 database file (`rk_estates.db`) is created automatically in the `/server` directory on first run. No database setup required.
351: 
352: ---
353: 
354: ## üì∏ Pages Overview
355: 
356: | Page | Who | Description |
357: |------|-----|-------------|
358: | `/login` | All | Login screen |
359: | `/register` | Buyer | Buyer signup |
360: | `/dashboard` | Buyer | Browse all projects |
361: | `/projects/[id]` | Buyer | Project detail with interactive plot grid |
362: | `/plot/[id]` | Buyer | Plot info + auto-generated 3D viewer |
363: | `/admin/dashboard` | Admin | Manage all projects |
364: | `/admin/create-project` | Admin | Enter land dimensions & plot count |
365: | `/admin/manage/[id]` | Admin | Edit project, update plot statuses |
366: 
367: ---
368: 
369: ## üõ£Ô∏è Roadmap
370: 
371: - [x] Project setup & architecture planning
372: - [ ] Authentication system (buyer + admin roles)
373: - [ ] Admin: Create project with land dimensions & plot count
374: - [ ] Backend: Auto plot division algorithm in Python
375: - [ ] SQLite3 database schema & SQLAlchemy models
376: - [ ] Frontend: Interactive plot grid layout
377: - [ ] Three.js: Procedural 3D plot viewer from dimensions
378: - [ ] Admin: Plot status management (Available / Booked / Sold)
379: - [ ] Buyer: Enquiry form on plot page
380: - [ ] Deployment (Vercel + Render)
381: - [ ] Payment / booking flow *(future)*
382: - [ ] Mobile app *(future)*
383: 
384: ---
385: 
386: ## ü§ù Contributing
387: 
388: Pull requests are welcome. For major changes, please open an issue first to discuss what you'd like to change.
389: 
390: ---
391: 
392: ## üìÑ License
393: 
394: [MIT](LICENSE)
395: 
396: ---
397: 
398: ## üì¨ Contact
399: 
400: **RK Estates Team**
401: - üìß Email: contact@rkestates.com
402: - üåê Website: [www.rkestates.com](https://www.rkestates.com)
403: - üìç Location: India

(End of file - total 403 lines)

metadata.preview:
# üèóÔ∏è RK Estates ‚Äî Real Estate Platform with Auto Plot Division & 3D Viewer

> A full-stack real estate web platform where admins define land dimensions, the system automatically divides land into plots, and buyers explore each plot through an interactive 3D view.

---

## üìå Project Overview

**RK Estates** is a role-based real estate web application with two distinct user types ‚Äî **Admin** and **Buyer**.

- **Admin** creates a project by entering land dimensions and the desired number of plots. The system automatically divides the land into equal plots and generates a 3D visualization for each one.
- **Buyers** log in, browse projects, select a plot from an interactive layout, and view a 3D model of that specific plot ‚Äî no site visit needed.

---

## ‚ú® Features

### üë§ Buyer Features
- üîê Secure login & signup with JWT authentication
- üèòÔ∏è Browse all available real estate projects

parts.text: The user asked me to understand the README.md file fully, each and every line. Let me summarize what this project is about comprehensively.

This is a **full-stack real estate web platform** called **RK Estates** with the following key aspects:

### Core Concept
- **Two user roles**: Admin and Buyer
- **Admin** creates projects by entering land dimensions + number of plots ‚Üí system auto-divides land into plots + generates 3D models
- **Buyer** browses projects, views interactive plot grid, clicks a plot to see its 3D model, submits enquiries

### Tech Stack
- **Frontend**: React/Next.js, Three.js (3D), Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion
- **Backend**: Python FastAPI, SQLite3, SQLAlchemy, JWT auth (python-jose, bcrypt)
- **Dev tools**: Git, Swagger UI, Postman

### Key Features
1. **Auto Plot Division**: Algorithm takes total land (e.g., 200√ó150ft), divides into N equal plots, calculates dimensions, assigns facing direction (N/S/E/W)
2. **Auto 3D Generation**: Three.js procedurally generates 3D mesh from plot dimensions (no manual uploads)
3. **JWT Authentication**: Secure login/signup with role-based access (buyer vs admin)
4. **Interactive Plot Grid**: Color-coded grid showing Available/Booked/Sold status
5. **Enquiry System**: Buyers can submit enquiries directly from plot pages

### Database (SQLite3)
- `users`: id, name, email, hashed_password, role, created_at
- `projects`: id, name, location, description, land_length, land_width, num_plots
- `plots`: id, project_id, plot_number, length, width, area, row_index, col_index, facing, price, status

### API Endpoints
- Auth: `/api/auth/register`, `/api/auth/login`, `/api/auth/me`
- Projects: CRUD at `/api/projects`
- Plots: GET, get dimensions for 3D, update status at `/api/plots`

### Running Locally
1. Backend: `cd server` ‚Üí create venv ‚Üí `pip install -r requirements.txt` ‚Üí `uvicorn main:app --reload --port 8000`
2. Frontend: `cd client` ‚Üí `npm install` ‚Üí `npm run dev`
3. Backend runs at `localhost:8000`, frontend at `localhost:3000`
